head.title: Climate Change Imposes Heavy Financial Cost; Big Oil Wins Again

hedline.hl1: Climate Change Imposes Heavy Financial Cost; Big Oil Wins Again

abstract.p: Lawrence Heyl Jr letter comments on October 8 Business Day article on latest developments in fuel cell technology (S)

block.p: In your useful survey of fuel cell developments (Business Day, Oct. 8), one sentence may raise more questions than it answers: ''This debate [about which fuel to use] pits fuel-cell supporters against big oil companies, since the fuel of choice is pure hydrogen, which does not come from an oil well but can be derived from methane and natural gas.''

In your useful survey of fuel cell developments (Business Day, Oct. 8), one sentence may raise more questions than it answers: ''This debate [about which fuel to use] pits fuel-cell supporters against big oil companies, since the fuel of choice is pure hydrogen, which does not come from an oil well but can be derived from methane and natural gas.''
What is not made clear is that the oil companies are typically the discoverers and producers of natural gas, which is often found in association with crude oil and produced from the same wells.
LAWRENCE HEYL JR. Nyack, N.Y., Oct. 8, 1997
